metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12222 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in libSDL2.a in Simple DirectMedia Layer (SDL) 2.0.9. There is an out-of-bounds read in the function SDL_InvalidateMap at video/SDL_pixels.c. USN-4238-1 addressed serveral vulnerabilities in SDL_image. This update provides the corresponding fixes for Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12222` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-5+deb9u1ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
sdl-image1.2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-5+deb9u1ubuntu0.16.04.1').
